modules.name: BASICally
modules.description: Generate sequences, perform math on inputs, and even multitask with a simple BASIC-like language. Can also send Tipsy text messages to modules that support them (e.g., TTY).

modules.name: Drifter
modules.description: Varying linear function generator. Makes sequences that change in small (or large) ways. A line defined by X/Y points, each doing a random walk.

modules.name: Fermata
modules.description: Write much longer text notes, and various sizes of labels. Fermata is resizable, scrolls, has font, font size, and color choices, and more.

modules.name: Fuse
modules.description: Counts triggers and blocks/allows a signal after hitting a limit. Useful for timed composition changes, simulating components that break with overuse, or scaling a value based on the number of triggers.

modules.name: TTY
modules.description: Logs values from cables and/or text messages from Tipsy text sources (e.g., BASICally, Memory). Makes monitoring of values or logging far easier. TTY is resizable, scrolls, has font, font size, and color choices, and more.

modules.name: Memory
modules.description: The root part of a Memory Ensemble, optimized for audio. What Fixation and Ruminate reads, Embellish and Brainwash write to and Depict displays.

modules.name: MemoryCV
modules.description: The root part of a MemoryCV Ensemble, optimized for control voltage. What Fixation and Ruminate reads, Embellish and Brainwash write to and Depict displays.

modules.name: Ruminate
modules.description: A playback head within a Memory Ensemble that plays the entire Memory or MemoryCV.

modules.name: Fixation
modules.description: Playback head with a Memory Ensemble that repeatedly plays a short part of the Memory or MemoryCV.

modules.name: Embellish
modules.description: A recording and playback head for a Memory or MemoryCV Ensemble.

modules.name: Depict
modules.description: Visualizes activity of other modules within a Memory Ensemble.

modules.name: Venn
modules.description: 2D graphical control signals. A single moving or mouse-driven point causes up to 16 circles to output signals based on the point's position within them.

modules.name: Brainwash
modules.description: Records input and then replaces the contents of a Memory or MemoryCV.
